alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 19 at 3:51PM MST until November 20 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...North winds at 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Central and western portions of Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties in Colorado. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel on east/west roads could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. This includes Interstate 70 in Kit Carson County, Colorado and Highway 40 in Cheyenne County, Colorado. High winds may also move loose debris and damage property.
info.instruction: A High Wind Watch means that sustained winds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or greater are possible. Secure loose outdoor items and stay tuned for later forecasts and possible warnings.
